comment: This class was super easy content wise and I would take the professor again, he was very accomadating especially when I was having problems with my lock down browser on one test. However, there is so much content especially for an online class! Constant lectures to watch, papers, long test, too many discussion boards.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I think this professor is solid. He is also pretty funny to me, he doesn't make lectures super boring, even though it's a history class. All you have to do is take notes of the lectures and do an assignment by the end of the week. However, there are a few papers and he does 80-question exams with a lockdown browser that aren't the most appealing...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I am really not sure why his rating is so low as the class is not hard if you do the work. It is very lecture heavy but as long as you listen to the lectures and take notes while listening its not hard. There is a discussion post each week and two essays with in depth rubrics. The tests are long but as long as you pay attention to lectures its easy
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Worst Professor in KSU History department Period!!!! Can't we have 20 question quizes on each chapter to see the style of questions and learn rather than 80 question exam 100 minutes to complete!!!! Get ready to get points taken off on your essay and discussions!!! Worst Professor in KSU!!! Period!!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Sophomore/Junior Mech engineer major. This was the hardest class I have taken at this school. Let that sink in.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: He ignored all my emails throughout the semester until the last one I sent about how lockdown browser wasn't letting me finish my test. He acted like he wasn't going to let me retake the test b/c no one else complained about their test having issues and ultimately he didn't let me retake it. he doesn't expand on why you lose points on assignments

He's honestly not that bad of a professor his lectures are very helpful and informative.He does do lockdown browsers for the exams, but as long as you read the textbook and watch the lectures you could pass. The discussion questions are fairly easy with simple guidelines. The essays are graded thoroughly so follow the directions carefully.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: I think his rating is a bit low. While the class did have a lot of reading and lecture videos, (I took it online) his grading was very fair and mostly based on the effort you put in. The tests were also easier than they could've been. Overall, he was understanding and actually put effort into teaching, so I'd recommend him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Just for clarity, I am a freshman taking Diff Eq and Phys II. This class was the hardest class I have ever taken at this university. On the unnecessary essays this is the type of guy to say "This was a pretty solid essay," then proceed to deduct 11 points for no reason. Oh, and the tests were practically impossible to not fail in. Run.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: The test are 80 questions with lockdown + webcam, the "study guides" are somewhat useless due to the lack of valuable information. Not many cushion grades, so you have to do good with the test and discussions. I wouldn't take him again due to it being unnecessarily hard and time consuming, especially if your major has nothing to do with history.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: guys when the reviews say 80 test questions, they arent a joke. these test are difficult and you will put more effort towards this class then classes towards your major. i HIGHLY recommend you take another professor and if you cant then tough luck. you do use the textbook sometimes and he does have midterm/final essays. 9+ videos per week
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Took Watson for HIST2111 online and it was great. He has video lectures that add up to 2 ish hours each week but that's all you need to pass the class. There is a textbook thats free online but you don't have to read it to pass if you watch his videos and do your discussion posts.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Ill just make it plain and simple: He post 15 minute lecture videos which could be easily said in less than 5, doesnt respond in time, doesnt give study guides and expects us to answer detailed 80 question exams, powerpoints which are useless unless you watch the boring lectures he does. Overall, he seems very negligent and not care about students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: This class is not for the faint of heart. Be ready to watch every lecture as exams are mainly based on them. Long exams. He has two papers and multiple discussions all of which must have citations from the textbook. For a core class it felt like more work than normal. Not a very entertaining in his videos as he thinks he is.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was very difficult. The tests are 80 questions long and they are confusing. The professor is nice however he does not respond in a timely manner. The tests are outrageous when it comes to what you are provided to study. The video lectures are ok however they are not enough. This class could be set up for success with a few major tweaks.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: This class is absolutely ridiculous. 80 question tests with short answer. DO NOT take this class!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I made a RMP account just to write a review on this guy. Whatever you do, and trust me WHATEVER you do, AVOID THIS MAN. This was the third ever B I have ever gotten, and I by no means am a slacker when it comes to difficult classes, but this one was so insanely difficult. Was only 6 points away from a C grade. Literally take anyone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: A very hard professor who writes his own 80-question tests with a lockdown browser. If you don't watch his lecture videos you will have difficulty with his tests. The tests are backed by semi-easy busy work but if you don't do them correctly, he won't hesitate to take points off.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Every assignment is straight forward if you follow the rubric he posts, you'll be sure to get 100 on almost everything by following directions. This is a lecture heavy course but his tests are based around the lectures, so if you make flashcards as you go you'll be fine. He may not post a study guide for each test and he is hard to reach sometimes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment:
Tests are quite difficult with fill in the blank portions (which he does correct for misspellings thankfully).
Doesn't respond to emails from what I've seen.
Extremely hard to contact if you have problems.

Sign up for your classes early so you are not stuck with this guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Professor Watson never response emails, no study guide and expect us to know everything. The discussions posts are pretty strict but easy if you follow the rubric. I don't really like history but I would not recommend taking his class.

DO NOT TAKE HIM !! This was the worst class Ive taken since attending KSU and the first class I ever dropped. His lectures are annoyingly long and he acts as if we are all history majors and not in a gen ed course. His tests were very hard with many fill in the blanks and short responses with lockdown webcam browser. All I have to say is RUNNNN.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Please don't take, never respond to the email. Extremely hard test, you don't have any review material

Stephen Watson is the instructor that everyone is warned about prior to attending college. He is unreachable and does not respond to emails, his exams contain a lot of obscure one off examples, and he grades essays like he expects his students to have a graduate level degree in literature. I would never recommend him to anyone.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: His tests are super hard, and have chronological order questions, but his lectures were out of order. As well as short response questions that were hard, because they were about one word response, but you had to fill in the blank without any help. There were also two essays that were pretty easy. Only four tests, but all of them were difficult.

Weekly video lectures. The grades were 4 tests, 2 papers, and the weekly discussions. The class was very lecture heavy, I only used the textbook when I needed to cite something in a paper or post, but the tests can be done 100% without them. The hardest part is remembering events in chronological order, but the lectures have a thing to practice
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Seems like a good guy but is a horrible teacher. Exams are absolutely horrible and expects you to remember every event in chronological order. Weekly discussions are not bad, just busy work. He has two big essays for the semester that he grades harder on grammar than he does on historical content and relevancy. Would not take him again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Never take this guy's class. He is the professor that you were warned about. I took an online class with him and he does not respond to messages or emails. His lectures are full of woke garbage. The tests are very difficult and he grades the essays like he expects you to already have a masters in English. It is virtually impossible to get an A.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Mr. Watson is a really good guy and teacher. You can tell he does try to help his students succeed and cares about his job and what he is teaching. You do need to work for your grade though. The tests were hard but he put out videos each week with the question topics. It was online for covid this year, only did discussion posts and tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: He is really nice and understanding. Theres just a lot of material so this class wouldnt be for someone lazy. If you have good study habits youll do just fine and you will for sure learn a lot in this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Watson is a great professor. He really takes his time to make the lecture as interesting and engaging as possible. Yes, he is very particular about proper grammar. If you want an easy A, find another instructor. If you want to learn more about your history, take Prof Watson. Take detailed notes and you will get an easy A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Grade consists of 5 quizzes, 4 discussion posts, 2 essays, and a final, which was an essay. He is a really tough grader on the essays, and really focuses on the grammar and structure more than the actual history content. All of the quizzes are lockdown and webcam, and they are cumulative. All of the lectures are 15+ minutes, with three per unit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: He cares more about grammar and spelling than the actual content. All quizzes and tests are online with webcam. The questions come from the textbook mainly but ask about obscure details that no one should need to remember. He is not understanding and runs a tight schedule. Be prepared to read and watch his long and unnecessary lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: He is a good professor and cares for his students education but the test are very difficult. The test are on lockdown with camera . You really have to study for this class and no phones are allowed in class.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Makes lots of jokes. You can tell he cares. Does take a while to grade papers, but provides good feedback. Must read textbook for in-class quizzes. No technology in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I really enjoyed his lectures. He gives a few pop quizzes on the textbook (they aren't difficult). Tests are a little difficult but as long as you read and study your notes you'll do fine. All the exams were we online with a webcam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Prof. Watson is a solid instructor. His lectures are lucid and laid-back, and he tests mostly from lecture notes. There are four exams and three papers, but two of the papers are quite short. Be aware that he does give graded pop quizzes, so read the textbook before class. Exams are online with a webcam. Don't skip class; it will cost you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ok prof. Engaging lectures. Very uptight. Will stop class/make a scene for cell phones etc. Tests are multiple-choice but have ambiguous questions and require you to remember obscure info about events and can be unnecessarily difficult. Grades papers like an English professor. Lots of reading. Makes it a hassle to get an A. Full schedules, avoid.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Watson was the absolute worse teacher I ever had. He is rude, you can't make a peep during lectures, and all of his tests are online using a webcam. I would never this class with him again even if someone paid me
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I enjoyed Professor Watson's class. He's a pretty chill guy and makes jokes during his lectures. You do lose points if you don't attend, but that said, I would suggest attending and taking notes if you want to do well. Reading every other night can get a bit tedious, but if you read it and take detailed notes in class, you'll get an easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His tests are online with a webcam and are very difficult. Gives many two question pop quizzes off assigned readings in the textbook throughout the semester. Assigns two papers that are graded hard. Not an easy class.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: This SJW made some jokes. Read from your textbook every night, a pop quiz may be the next day. Although, he will drop your lowest 3-5 quiz grades. He is very specific about essays, there are only 2 essay assignments but he grades them heavily. Tests aren't that hard if you listen and take notes in class. I wouldn't suggest skipping.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Had to withdraw from this class because the tests were so hard. Went to class everyday and took notes but still failed the tests. Uses Respondus Lockdown for tests which feels very uncomfortable. Gets mad for people using their phone and at times can sound condescending.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He's one of the better history professors I've had. His lectures are interesting and easy to follow. You will do fine if you pay attention and take good notes. There are around 10 pop quizzes throughout the year but they are only 2 questions and he drops half of them. The tests are rather straight forward and you'll do fine if you study.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Excellent choice for a gen ed requirement. His lectures are easy to follow, but to be safe I would record the lectures because things that are said aren't listed on the powerpoint slides.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very good lecturer. Goes into great detail and doesn't just read the powerpoint slides. The tests are also easy and basically are just recaps of his lectures. Reading quizzes every class but he ended up dropping my lowest 5. Didn't study much at all and got all a's and b's on tests
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. He's not specific about the material to cover so you have to depend heavily on your textbook & the window to take his Respondus LockDown tests are only a few hours when I've had other professors keep the availability open for a week at most. His lectures are also very boring & he talks just to hear himself
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Watson is a great lecturer. He tries to make things interesting by making jokes and deterring from the traditional style of lecturing because we all know how history can be dry. There are readings every night and a quiz on those readings everyday. They take up a good chunk of grading so it would probably be a good idea to read ahead.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor! I found the work load to be easy. It wasn't a lot of reading. He is an easy grader, and his lectures are interesting. Prof. Watson is  caring and extremely understanding. It's not hard to pass the class all you have to do is show up to every class and take notes. I would take his class again in a heartbeat.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Amazing lectures

comment: 4 Tests and 3 Papers. Nothing too serious though. Very interesting lectures. Great Prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The key to being successful on his tests is being in class. Yes, you will have selected readings but most of the questions are based off lecture. If you miss class you jeopardize your test score.  He is a tough grader on the writings assignments which makes it really hard to get an A even if you made all A's on the test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Online tests, monitored by webcam. 3 writing assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: He is a great professor! His lectures are interesting and if you pay attention and take notes, you will do great on his tests. When I studied my notes, the test was exactly the same and in the same order we learned everything. Only 1 paper in the class. Very good option for a required course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Requires reading and gives daily quizzes over the reading. If you read, you would easily make a 100. He drops your 4 lowest quizzes. Only one paper in this class and I made an 87 on it (I'm not a stronger writer at all). His tests were EXACTLY the lectures (I made B's on all with night-before studying). Easy to listen to, can miss a few classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: There are daily reading quizzes but he drops your lowest 5. Tests (40 questions) come straight from his powerpoints so just take good notes and listen to what he says. There is one easy research paper towards the end of the semester. Overall, I didn't mind Professor Watson, just be ready to read a lot!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Awesome guy who loves what he teaches and wants students to learn. Attendance is not mandatory however there is a reading quiz everyday. Post lectures online and tests are off lectures. Test are pretty straightforward.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Reading is a must. Quizzes with 2 questions at the beginning of each class 95% of the times u have class, which is his way of getting you to go. Drops the 4 lowest quiz grades out of 30-40 quizzes, 4 exams, and a writing assignment. He's a genuinely good guy and very professional. Read, pay attention to lectures & take notes u will do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Every class there is a reading quiz. Take only if you can dedicate yourself to reading everything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: I thoroughly enjoyed having Professor Watson for history. He is a patient and kind person when it comes to asking a question or for clarification of information during class. He has a very active and attention-grabbing personality to keep you interested in his lectures over the content. There's a 2 question quiz every class over reading assigned.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Mr. Watson is actually a pretty cool guy despite what they say. He makes class entertaining with all of his interesting stories. I enjoy his class even though I never really went. The daily quizzes are typically easy and so are the test if you pay attention.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: People say he is a hard teacher, but that is false!  He is great at keeping you interested in the subject and making sure the student understands.  He posts the PowerPoints online so you can go back and review notes. The reading he uses is really easy to comprehend. There is reading for everyday basically, but it is not a heavy load of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Caring

comment: One of the worst professors I've taken at KSU. I am a history major & he made me feel like a complete idiot almost every class. Mandatory quizzes every class over readings. Took his notes VERBATIM & still bombed the first test & he offered no feedback when I approached him. Very difficult for a lower level class, would not recommend.

He gives quizzes every day, but only drops the lowest two. So if you are absent more than twice, you'll have zeros for quizzes. Also his quizzes are based on readings from the textbook and can be really hard or really easy. It's a crap shoot, but if you don't read you're gonna have a hard time. His tests are hard. You really have to work for an A.
Expect homework and a quiz over it every single class.

There is a quiz every day, so if you miss one day thats a 0.  A LOT of reading you will not pass without reading so i suggest you get the textbook or fail. He explains everything with detail and will answer any of your questions. His test arent multiple choice and neither are his daily quizzes. Get ready to read and Study. Good Luck!
